description: Surrogate primary key for a work order status record; unique row identifier.
Business identifier or name of the work order status used in user interfaces and rules.
Long-form explanation or notes describing the status's purpose and use.
Flag indicating this is the default status assigned to new work orders.
Numeric code grouping statuses into broader lifecycle categories; likely system-defined mapping; confirm with SME.
When set, inventory is reserved or committed to the work order upon entering this status.
When set, parts are issued or consumed from inventory for the work order in this status.
Controls whether labor resources can be allocated or scheduled while the work order is in this status.
Controls whether labor time and charges can be recorded while in this status.
Controls whether miscellaneous costs or fees can be applied to the work order at this status.
Indicates whether asset downtime should be recorded or accumulated while the work order is in this status.
Makes the work order read-only in this status, preventing edits except permitted transitions.
Requires entry of a reason or authorization code when setting this status; exact code set likely system-configured; confirm with SME.
Triggers a warning if required parts are not available in inventory when moving to this status.
Sends a notification to the designated receiver or requester when ordered parts for the work order are received; recipient role likely system-defined; confirm with SME.
Prompts the user if estimated items remain unconverted to actuals before proceeding with this status change.
Prompts the user to enter completion details when applying this status.
Prompts the user to provide cancellation details when applying this status.
Excludes this status from selection lists and lookups to limit use.
Excludes this status from standard reports or analytics outputs.
Free-text comments or label associated with the status, used for display or administrative notes.
System timestamp of the most recent update to this status record.
Controls whether this status definition is synchronized to mobile field devices.
Prevents the status field from being changed once applied to a work order; behavior likely system-specific; confirm with SME.
Enables resource capacity planning or allocation features for work orders in this status.
Audit timestamp of the last user-initiated modification to this record; may differ from system-modified time; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the user who created the status record.
Timestamp when the status record was created.
Identifier of the user who last modified the status record.
Timestamp when the status record was last modified by a user.
Allows entry and management of estimated parts for the work order in this status.
